Description: Fragment of wall of Attic red-figured pottery krater; inside glazed; outside, to left, a hand grasping two spears; to right, extended arm of female and some chiton drapery. A pursuit scene
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
W. Kraiker, Die rotfigurigen attischen Vasen (1978) 58,225. Heidelberg, Antikenmuseum I52-I77 and I85-I92 have in the past been erroneously known and cited as J52-77 and J85-92.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1124)
